summary: 01/01/2012: A grenade was thrown into a shop on Joint Road, Quetta city, Balochistan province, Pakistan. Twelve people were injured in the blast, and damage was done to a number of nearby shops. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
propcomment: The targeted shops, as well as several other shops in the area, were damaged in this attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Given the political and criminal context in Pakistan, the attack on the shop may have been the result of local crime. However, given the high number of casualties, a political motive cannot be dismissed.
scite1: "16 hurt in hand grenade attacks in Quetta, Hub," Daily The Post, January 3, 2012.
scite2: "Grenade attack injures five in Quetta," Daily The Post, January 2, 2012.
scite3: "Grenade attack injures nine in Quetta," Plus News Pakistan, January 2, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: Assailants threw two grenades and opened fire on Locus Pub as people were celebrating the new year in Garissa city, North Eastern region, Kenya. This was one of two attacks on bars just after midnight on January 1, 2012 in Garissa. Across the two attacks, five people were killed and 28 injured. No group claimed responsibility; however, sources suspected Al-Shabaab.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, Al-Shabaab had vowed to retaliate against Kenya for crossing the border into Somalia to attack them in October 2011.
weapdetail: Two grenades and AK-47 assault rifles were used in the attack.
propcomment: The dance floor was damaged in this attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this attack represent an equal division of a cumulative total of killed and wounded across incidents 201201010002 and 201201010004. Casualty numbers for this incident conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority estimates are reported here.
scite1: "BRIEF: Five killed in   grenade attack   in northern Kenya," DPA (Berlin), January 1, 2012.
scite2: "UPDATE 2-Gunmen attack bars in northeast Kenya, 5 dead," Reuters News, January 1, 2012.
scite3: "Gunmen attack bars in northeast Kenya, at least 2 dead," Plus News Pakistan, January 2, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: A convoy of Frontier Corps (FC) soldiers hit two landmines in Sui subdistrict, Balochistan province, Pakistan. Four soldiers were killed and three injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack, but sources attributed it to the Baloch Republican Army (BRA).
propcomment: The victim's vehicle was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "4 security personnel killed in blast," The Press Trust of India Limited, January 1, 2012.
scite2: "FACTBOX-Security developments in Pakistan, Jan 1," Reuters News, January 1, 2012.
scite3: "4 FC men killed in Dera Bugti blast," The Nation, January 2, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: Assailants threw a grenade and opened fire on a bar as people were celebrating the new year in Garissa city, North Eastern region, Kenya. This was one of two attacks on bars just after midnight on January 1, 2012 in Garissa. Across the two attacks, five people were killed and 28 injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, but sources suspected Al-Shabaab.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, Al-Shabaab has vowed to retaliate against Kenya for crossing the border into Somalia to attack them in October, 2011.
propcomment: An unknown number of vehicles and a nightclub were damaged in this attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this attack represent an equal division of a cumulative total of killed and wounded across incidents 201201010002 and 201201010004. Casualty numbers for this incident conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority estimates are reported here.
scite1: "UPDATE 2-Gunmen attack bars in northeast Kenya, 5 dead," Reuters News, January 1, 2012.
scite2: "Five dead in New Year blast in Kenyan town: police," Agence France Presse, January 1, 2012.
scite3: "Five dead in New Year blast in Kenyan town: police," Agence France Presse, January 1, 2012.

location: Incident occurred near Pahao Bridge in Nasirabad district.
summary: 01/01/2012: Four men were kidnapped from their car in Peer Chhatta area, Nasirabad district, Balochistan province, Pakistan. They were rescued on January 19, 2012. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
scite1: "4 kidnapped recovered," Pakistan Press International Information Services, January 20, 2012.
scite2: "3 brothers kidnapped in Nasirabad," The Baluchistan Times, January 3, 2012.

location: Incident occurred in the Bajaur Agency
summary: 01/01/2012: An explosive device targeting anti-Taliban fighters detonated in a market in Salarzai area, Bajaur Agency, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. One person was killed and three injured. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
propcomment: A shop was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Bomb kills 1 anti-Taliban militiaman in Pakistan," The Associated Press, January 1, 2012.
scite2: "Bomb kills anti-Taliban fighter in Pakistan," Agence France Presse, January 1, 2012.
scite3: "Anti-Taliban fighter killed in Bajaur," Daily Times, January 2, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: The convoy of Sunni finance minister Rafe al-Essawi hit a roadside bomb in Samarra city, Saladin governorate, Iraq. Two bodyguards were injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, a source speculates that the bombing against the Sunni finance minister was of a sectarian nature.
weapdetail: A roadside bomb was used in the attack.
propcomment: The victim's vehicle was damaged in this attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this incident conflict across sources. Following GTD protocol, the majority estimates are reported here.
scite1: "Reports Differ of Attack on an Iraqi Minister," The New York Times, January 3, 2012.
scite2: "Iraqi minister escapes in bomb attack; World Bulletin," The Daily Telegraph, January 3, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: A North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) vehicle struck a roadside bomb in Karez area, Shindand district, Helmand province, Afghanistan. There were no casualties, but the vehicle was damaged. No group claimed responsibility, but sources attributed the attack to the Taliban.
corp1: North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO): International Security Assistance Force (ISAF)
propcomment: An ISAF vehicle was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "ISAF vehicle damaged, missile hits Bagram base," The Frontier Post (Pakistan), January 2, 2012.
scite2: "ISAF vehicle damaged, missiles hit Bagram Airbase separately," Afghan Islamic Press (AIP), January 1, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and Afghan troops discovered and detonated explosives in Sanzari subdistrict, Zhari district, Kandahar province, Afghanistan. No one was injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
scite1: "ISAF vehicle damaged, missile hits Bagram base," The Frontier Post (Pakistan), January 2, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: An explosive device detonated near the house of a tribal elder in Landi Kotal town, Khyber Agency, Federally Administered Tribal Areas, Pakistan. Two people were killed and nine injured in the incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
weapdetail: A homemade bomb was used in the attack.
scite1: "2 killed, 9 wounded in Khyber Agency," Daily The Pak Banker, January 1, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: Assailants attacked a Congolese village in Shabunda territory, South Kivu province, Democratic Republic of the Congo. This was one of three attacks by the group in a two-day span. Eighteen people were killed in this attack, and 13 were wounded across all three. The Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR) claimed responsibility for the incidents, stating that they were in revenge for locals allying themselves with Raia Mutomboki, a local defense group.
gname: Democratic Front for the Liberation of Rwanda (FDLR)
motive: The attack by the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda was in revenge for locals allying themselves with Raia Mutomboki, a local defense group.
propcomment: Six houses were damaged in this attack.
addnotes: Casualty numbers for this attack represent an equal division of a cumulative total of wounded across incidents 201201010013, 201201030040, and 201201030041.
scite1: "Rwandan Hutu rebels kill 26 in DR Congo: army," Agence France Presse, January 4, 2012.
scite2: "Rebels kill 26 in eastern Congo attacks - army," Reuters News, January 4, 2012.
scite3: "Congo: 45 Civilians Killed in South Kivu," The New York Times, January 6, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: A sticky bomb attached to a civilian car detonated in Qara Durra area, Kirkuk, Iraq. One person was killed and four injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
propcomment: A vehicle was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Civilian killed, 4 injured in Kirkuk blast," Aswat al-Iraq, January 2, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: Gunmen attacked the convoy of the vice president of the Awami National Party (ANP), Malik Sheroz Khan, in Khwajarhi village, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, Pakistan. Khan's bodyguards returned fire, injuring one attacker. No group claimed responsibility for the incident.
propcomment: It is unknown if the victim's vehicle was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "ANP leader escapes attempt on life," Plus News Pakistan, January 3, 2012.
scite2: "Attack on Pakistan party vice-president in northwest - report," The News website, Islamabad, January 3, 2012.

summary: 01/01/2012: An explosive device detonated targeting a police patrol near the Old Diyala Bridge in Rashid area, Baghdad governorate, Iraq. The explosion injured five people and damaged a vehicle. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
propcomment: A vehicle was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "9 persons injured Baghdad attacks," Aswat al-Iraq, January 2, 2012.

location: The incident occurred in the Rashid area of the city.
summary: 01/01/2012: Several Katyusha rockets were fired at a housing complex in Rashid area, Baghdad governorate, Iraq. Four people were injured in the incident, and the complex sustained structural damage. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
weapdetail: Multiple Katyusha rockets were used in the attack.
propcomment: Several houses were damaged in this attack.
scite1: "9 persons injured Baghdad attacks," Aswat al-Iraq, January 2, 2012.
